title: Medication Treatment for Addiction Is Shorter for Black and Hispanic Patients, Study Finds
description: The analysis of 15 years of prescription data showed that the racial disparities are widening.
dc:creator: Emily Baumgaertner
media:description: Researchers agreed the duration of treatment for all groups were far lower than the recommended six months. For white patients, the median treatment duration was about 53 days; for Black patients, about 44 days; and for Hispanic patients, less than 40.
